questions.question: Which SQL keyword is used to sort the result-set in ascending or descending order?

options.B: A unique identifier for a row

options.C: Groups rows that have the same values into summary rows

questions.question: Which method is used to add an element to the end of an array in JavaScript?
What is a closure in JavaScript?

options.A: A function that returns a value
options.B: A function that has access to variables from its outer (enclosing) function's scope, even after the outer function has finished executing
options.C: A loop that iterates over an array
options.D: A way to define a class

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'addEventListener' method?

options.A: To create a new HTML element
options.B: To attach an event handler to an element
options.C: To modify the CSS of an element
options.D: To remove an element from the DOM

questions.question: What is the difference between '==' and '===' in JavaScript?

options.A: '==' compares values, '===' compares values and types
options.B: '===' compares values, '==' compares values and types
options.D: '==' is for strings, '===' is for numbers

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'map()' method in JavaScript?

options.B: To iterate over an array and create a new array with the results of a provided function
options.D: To reduce an array to a single value

questions.question: What is the purpose of JSON.stringify()?

options.B: To convert a JavaScript object to a JSON string
options.C: To create a new JSON object

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'setTimeout()' function?

options.B: To execute a function after a specified delay
options.C: To stop the execution of a function
